com.xceptance.xlt.ai.image

Class Convolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.ai.image.Convolution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IApplyInPlace

    public class Convolution
extends java.lang.Object
implements IApplyInPlace
    Convolution is applied to images for filtering. In dependence of the used kernel the effects can vary.

    Supported types: Grayscale, RGB.
    Coordinate System: Matrix.

    Author:
    Diego Catalano edited by Thomas Volkmann

      • applyInPlace

        public void applyInPlace(FastBitmap fastBitmap)
        Use the convolution on the Image, in respective to the chosen Kernel. A kernel is always used on the current pixel and the surrounding pixels. Which effect this will have depends on the Image and the kernel.
        Specified by:
        applyInPlace in interface IApplyInPlace
        Parameters:
        fastBitmap - instead of BufferedImage this use an FastBitmap

      • CalcLines

        private int CalcLines(int[][] kernel)
        Analyze the kernel for its seize and generate the needed lines for the applying.
        Parameters:
        kernel - int 2D array with the kernel data
        Returns:
        lines number of needed lines
